result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Paul Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Paul Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek Paul Johnson was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to current sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: to current sentence

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Ashely V., Mr. St. Ores or address on Lundy Lane in Hudson WI.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Case called at 3:12 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites. No objection from Atty O'Boyle. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one. Counts two - seven are dismissed. 14CF355 and 14CF390 are also dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguments. Def makes statement. Court orders 3 years probation w/h with conditions - 
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Not to possess a firearm
- No contact with Mr. St. Ores, address on Lundy Lane in Hudson, Wi and A. Vandenberg
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Consecutive to current sentence
Ad Prosrquendum. Signed by EFV on 10/19/2015. c: DA, cc: SCSO. Fax: Sheriff and Jail. km

- Restitution - $300.00 - payable to the St. Croix County Sheriffs Office. To be joint and several with A. Vandenberg

- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with Ashley Vandenberg
- Subject to Random UA's and PBT's 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
Def is remanded to contact of the Sheriff's Department.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Case called at 3:43 pm. Hearing continued. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Includes JT on 14CF227 and 14CF433. Case called at 8:23 am w/o jurors. Court reviews file. Atty O'Boyle renews motion for mistrial. ADA Hahn responds. Recess. Recalled at 9:14 am w/o jurors. S/T K. Lloyd. Court questions. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Recess. Recalled at 9:26 am. Jurors in at 9:29 am. Court makes statement. S/T K. Lloyd. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. State rests. Jurors out at 9:47 am. Parties review exhibits. Ex #4 Offered, not received. Ex #3 Offered, not received. Atty O'Boyle makes motion to dismiss. ADA Hahn responds. Court denies motion to dismiss. Jurors in at 10:06 am. S/T Inv. Haefner. Direct by Atty O'Boyle. Cross by ADA Hahn. Jurors out at 10:25 am. Recess. Recalled at 10:36 am w/o jury. Court questions re: right to remain silent. Defendant understands. Atty O'Boyle questions Defendant.  Ex #8 O/R. Jurors in at 10:41. Defense rests. No rebuttal from the state. Jurors out at 10:42 am. Parties review Jury Instructions and Verdict Forms. Recess. Case recalled at 10:51 w/o jurors. Court questions K. Lloyd. K. Lloyd makes statement. Recess. Case recalled at 11:19 am w/jurors present. Court recites jury instructions. ADA Hahn makes closing statement at 11:33 am. Atty O'Boyle makes closing statement at 11:40 am. Oath to the Bailiff at 12:00pm. Jurors out at 12:01 pm. Recess. Case recalled at 12:54 pm. ADA Hartung for ADA Hahn. Jurors have a question. There is an objection. Recess. Case recalled at 1:26 pm w/ jurors present. There is a verdict. Court reads verdict: Guilty to Count #1. ADA Hahn makes statement. Court enters verdict and Judgment. Court orders PSI. Bond amended. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Case called at 8:33 am w/o jurors present. Includes JT on 14CF227 and STC on 14CF443. Court reviews file. Jurors will not ask questions. ADA Hahn makes statement. No alternate juror. Parties review Jury List.  Atty O'Boyle makes statement. ADA Hahn responds. Recess. Case recalled at 9:02 am w/o jurors present. Court questions parties. Recess. Case recalled at 9:08 am w/jurors present. Oath of Jurors as to qualification at 9:08 am. Jurors seated for Voir Dire at 9:11 am. Voir Dire done by the court at 9:16 am. Voir Dire done by ADA Hahn at 9:33 am. Voir Dire done by Atty O'Boyle at 9:40 am. Jurors selected at 10:05 am. Oath to Jurors at 10:06 am. Jurors out at 10:07 am. Court questions parties. Recess. Case recalled at 10:24 am w/jurors. ADA Hahn makes statement. Jurors in at 10:26 am. Court recites Preliminary Instructions. Atty's make opening statements at 10:36 am. S/T Inv. Haefner. Direct by ADA Hahn. Ex #1 Offered, not received at this time. Ex #2 O/R. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. Jurors out to lunch at 12:02 pm. ADA Hahn makes statement. Atty O'Boyle responds. Court quashes warrant on GF file. Recess. Case recalled at 1:21 pm w/o jurors. Court questions re: witness.  ADA Hahn makes statement. Atty O'Boyle responds. S/T A. Vandenberg. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. ADA Hahn makes statement. Jurors in at 1:43 pm. S/T Inv. Schultz. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty O'Boyle. Witness is released. S/T D. Fayerweather. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Recess. Case recalled at 2:19 w/ jurors present. S/T M. Gee. Direct by ADA Hahn. Ex#1 and #7 O/R. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. S/T A. Vandeberg. Direct by ADA Hahn.  Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Jurors out at 2:30 pm. Court questions K. Lloyd. S/T K. Lloyd. Direct by ADA Hahn. Court reviews right to testify with Defendant. Defendant understands. Jurors in at 2:42 pm. S/T K. Lloyd.  Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Jurors out at 3:05 pm. ADA Hahn makes statement. Atty O'Boyle responds. Court questions K. Lloyd. Recess. Recalled at 3:44 pm. Court makes statement. ADA Hahn makes statement. Atty O'Boyle responds. Recess. Case recalled at 4:29 pm. ADA Hahn makes statement. Atty O'Boyle makes motion for mistrial. ADA Hahn responds. Jurors in at 4:40 pm. Court makes statement. Jurors out at 4:42 pm. Case adjourned at 4:46 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Includes 14CF227 and 14CF433. Case called at 9:15 am. Set for Trial on 14CF227. ADA Hahn makes statement. 4 strikes each. No alternate juror. km
Filed by Atty O'Boyle. Re: request for bond modifcation. Per EFV, file. km
Filed by ADA Correll. Re: bond on file. km

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, No presence or drive on Lundy Lane, Ashley V., Paul S. and Barry P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- Not to use or possess firearms.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Derek Paul Johnson appeared. Case called at 8:44 a.m. ADA Correll filed a Motion to Modify Bond. No presence or drive on Lunde Lane. Bond already has no contact with the persons at that address. Atty O'Boyle has no objection to that amendment. Court grants request. ADA Correll states has a jury trial on another case that was prior to this matter. Asking for April status. Address confirmed. Bond continues. hml
